# UD Bengali BRU

Language: [Bengali](/bn/index.html) (code: `bn`)<br/>
Family: Indo-European, Indic

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.9 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Siratun Jannat, Mizanur Rahoman, Shafi Sourov, Jannatul Ferdaousi, Syeda Shahzadi, Daniel Zeman.

Repository: [UD_Bengali-BRU](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Bengali-BRU)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udbn_bru212)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.12](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: grammar-examples

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Bengali-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Bengali-BRU/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [siratunjannat&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;gmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;com, mdmizanur&nbsp;•&nbsp;rahoman&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;gmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;com, sourov&nbsp;•&nbsp;cse&nbsp;•&nbsp;brur&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;gmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;com, tuly19114&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;gmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;com, shahzadi&nbsp;•&nbsp;cse&nbsp;•&nbsp;brur&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;gmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;com].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

## Description

The BRU Bengali treebank has been created at Begum Rokeya University, Rangpur, by the members of Semantics Lab.

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 56 sentences and 320 tokens.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 39 tokens (12%) that are not followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words that contain both letters and punctuation.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 14 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADJ</a>, <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>INTJ</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>PUNCT</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>VERB</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: CCONJ, SYM, X</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3 word types tagged as particles (PART): কি, না, নাই</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 7 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): আমি, কি, কিছু, কে, তুমি, যে, সে</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 7 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): একটা, একটি, কি, কোন, তাই, না, নেই</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 1 lemmas occurred sometimes as PRON and sometimes as DET: কি</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): চাওয়া, পারা, হওয়া</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 1 lemmas occurred sometimes as AUX and sometimes as VERB: হওয়া</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>There are 4 <a href="../feat/VerbForm.html">(de)verbal forms:</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Fin
  <ul>
    <li>AUX: পার, চায়, পারি, পারো, হবে</li>
    <li>VERB: আসে, খেয়েছ, চল, জানো, ধোবো, নাও, বলব, যাই, যাব, হয়েছে</li>
  </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Inf
  <ul>
    <li>VERB: বসার, ভিক্ষা</li>
  </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Part
  <ul>
    <li>VERB: আঁকতে, খেতে, গাইতে, ঘুরতে, ধুয়ে, পড়তে, রেখে, করে, কিনে, খেয়ে</li>
  </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Vnoun
  <ul>
    <li>NOUN: পড়া, লেখা</li>
  </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain copulas.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 3 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: পারা, চাওয়া, হওয়া.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom (4)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Nom (12)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Nom (7)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>obj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Loc (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom (12)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Acc (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Loc (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (9)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Acc (1)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>iobj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Acc (1)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 4 relation subtypes: <a>acl:relcl</a>, <a>compound:lvc</a>, <a>nmod:poss</a>, <a>nsubj:pass</a></li>
<li>The following 14 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>csubj</a>, <a>expl</a>, <a>dislocated</a>, <a>cop</a>, <a>appos</a>, <a>nummod</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>cc</a>, <a>flat</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>reparandum</a>, <a>dep</a></li>
</ul>
